operations.specification:
This API operation enables the creation of a temporary guest user account (guestUser) without requiring traditional login credentials. It generates JWT-based temporary access tokens that allow non-authenticated browsing and minimal access features, supporting multi-channel shopping mall scenarios. No password or persistent identity is required, reflecting the guest nature of the role.

The API securely issues short-lived JWT tokens encapsulating guest session data. It only involves public access, allowing anyone to generate a temporary guest identity.

This operation integrates with the shopping_mall_guestusers Prisma table, ensuring session start timestamps and guest metadata are recorded for analytics and audit. It does not require a login step since guests do not authenticate with credentials.

This approach guarantees the seamless onboarding of guest users, improving initial user engagement and tracking while respecting security boundaries of guest access.

Related operations include refresh token renewal for guests but excludes login since guests do not authenticate.

The system enforces strict generation of tokens in compliance with session validity periods and guest user management best practices.
operations.description:
This join operation is specifically designed for the guestUser role. It creates a new guest user session without requiring traditional credential validation, enabling temporary access and browsing capabilities. The operation interfaces with the shopping_mall_guestusers table to persist session metadata corresponding with generated JWT tokens.

Security considerations include limited permission scopes for guest users and tightly scoped token lifetimes. This operation is public and requires no authentication, matching the guest user context.

In the broader identity management flow, this operation provides a basis for transitioning visitor sessions into registered member sessions, facilitating data consistency.

Token issuance strictly adheres to JWT standards with relevant claims reflecting the guest user context.

This operation does not involve password management or credential checks, consistent with guest user limited access.

Refreshing of guest tokens is handled by a separate refresh operation.
operations.summary: Create a temporary guest user account and issue access tokens using the shopping_mall_guestusers table

requestBody.description: Guest join request

operations.name: join

operations.specification:
This API operation supports token renewal for the guestUser role by accepting a valid refresh token and issuing new temporary access tokens. It does not require credentials but validates token-based permissions and refresh token validity.

The operation interfaces with stored JWT refresh tokens and guest session records within the shopping_mall_guestusers table to maintain token lifecycle management in adherence with security protocols.

This mechanism improves guest user experience by allowing seamless token refresh without re-authorization, maintaining temporary session continuity.

Security includes refresh token revocation support and limited token scope adherence.

Guest refresh tokens have defined expiration and renewal policies.

This operation complements guest join flows and excludes login operations.

Validation and error handling for token expiration and invalidation are integral parts.

This operation is restricted to authenticated refresh token holders within the guestUser role context.

The token format and renewal logic comply with JWT standards and role-specific claims.
operations.description:
Refresh temporary access tokens for guestUser role using valid refresh tokens. This operation involves validation of refresh tokens associated with shopping_mall_guestusers sessions.

It is designed for the guestUser role, which lacks traditional login credentials, thus the refresh is the primary means of token renewal.

Ensures secure token lifecycle management, preventing unauthorized refresh attempts and maintaining session integrity.

Integration with the shopping_mall_guestusers table allows tracking of active guest sessions and refresh token validity.

The operation strictly validates JWT refresh tokens and issues corresponding access tokens following JWT standards.

No password or credential validation is involved, consistent with the guest user model.

This operation must be invoked only with valid refresh tokens and appropriate role claims.

Complementary to guest join but excludes login as login is not applicable for guests.

Refresh token expiration policies apply as per security best practices for guest sessions.
operations.summary: Renew temporary JWT tokens for guestUser based on valid refresh tokens

requestBody.description: Guest refresh token request

operations.name: refresh

operations.specification: This API operation allows an authenticated member user to register (join) to the shopping mall system. It interacts with the 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table, which stores member user authentication credentials and personal information. During registration, the system collects necessary credentials such as email and password_hash, along with basic profile details like nickname and full_name. This operation creates a new member user account and issues JWT tokens for authentication purposes. It respects the soft deletion by managing the 'deleted_at' field and handles user status. The operation is designated as a "join" type for authorization to handle user registration. The endpoint is public and accessible without authentication, enabling new members to create accounts securely.
operations.description: This operation registers a new member user in the system by creating an account record in the 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table. It requires essential information such as email, password_hash, nickname, and full_name. The registration flow includes validation of unique email constraints and default status assignment. Soft deletion is monitored by the 'deleted_at' timestamp, and lifecycle management is maintained through 'status' and audit timestamps. Upon success, JWT tokens are issued encapsulated in the standardized response type. This registration endpoint is publicly accessible and serves as the entry point for new member users to join the shopping mall platform.
operations.summary: Member user registration operation linked to the 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table.

requestBody.description: Member user registration payload including credentials and profile data.

responseBody.description: Response confirming successful member registration with authentication tokens.

operations.name: join

operations.specification: This API operation allows an authenticated member user to log into the shopping mall system. It verifies the user's credentials (email and password_hash) against records in the 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table and issues JWT tokens upon successful authentication. This operation covers security considerations such as validating active status and checking for soft deletion via the 'deleted_at' field. It forms a critical part of the authentication workflow, enabling secure token management for session establishment. The endpoint requires no prior authentication as it serves as the login entry point for member users.
operations.description: This member user login operation authenticates users against the stored credentials in the 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table. It checks user status for active accounts and ensures that soft-deleted users are not permitted to log in. Upon successful authentication, JWT access and refresh tokens are generated and returned using the specified response type. This login endpoint is publicly accessible and crucial for securing member user sessions and access authorization.
operations.summary: Member user login operation referencing the 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table.

requestBody.description: Member user login credentials containing email and password.

responseBody.description: Response providing JWT access and refresh tokens for authenticated member user.

operations.name: login

operations.specification: This API operation refreshes JWT tokens for authenticated member users. It validates the provided refresh token and issues new access tokens as needed. This operation ensures session continuity and secure token management for users authenticated against the 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table. The token refresh respects user status and soft deletion status indicated by the 'deleted_at' field. This endpoint is secured to accept only valid refresh tokens and helps maintain secure re-authentication sessions without requiring full login.
operations.description: This token refresh operation validates an existing refresh token for a member user and issues new JWT access and refresh tokens. It ensures the user account is active and not soft-deleted according to the 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table constraints. This operation helps maintain secure, continuous sessions by renewing tokens without full credential re-entry. Access is authorized and requires a valid refresh token.
operations.summary: Member user token refresh operation based on 'shopping_mall_memberusers' table.

requestBody.description: Request payload containing refresh token for member user session renewal.

responseBody.description: Response containing renewed JWT access and refresh tokens for member user.

operations.name: refresh

operations.specification: Registration (join) operation for seller users enabling account creation and initial JWT issuance. This endpoint establishes a new seller account in the shopping_mall_sellerusers table. It accepts necessary signup information such as email, password, nickname, full name, phone number, business registration number, and sets the seller status as pending or active depending on business rules. Upon success, it issues an authorized JWT payload following the IShoppingMallSellerUser.IAuthorized response structure. This operation is public, no authentication required (authorizationType: join).
operations.description:
This API endpoint allows new seller users (members with seller permissions) to register by providing required credentials and profile data in accordance with the shopping_mall_sellerusers Prisma schema.

The operation performs validation of unique fields including email and business_registration_number and securely hashes the provided password before storage.

Upon successful registration, the system issues JWT access and refresh tokens embedding seller user identity and roles, conforming to the IShoppingMallSellerUser.IAuthorized type.

This operation is intended to be publicly accessible to enable new seller onboarding while ensuring data integrity and security.

Related operations include the login and token refresh endpoints for authentication lifecycle management.
operations.summary: Create a new seller user account and issue initial authorization tokens, tied to shopping_mall_sellerusers table.

requestBody.description: Seller user registration request body adhering to IShoppingMallSellerUser.ICreate structure.

responseBody.description: Authentication authorized response containing JWT tokens and seller user data.

operations.name: join

operations.specification: Login operation to authenticate seller users using email and password following schema-defined credentials. Validates credentials against the shopping_mall_sellerusers table including password hash verification. Upon success, issues new JWT access and refresh tokens embedding seller user roles and identity, returning data structured as IShoppingMallSellerUser.IAuthorized. The endpoint is public and does not require prior authentication.
operations.description:
This API endpoint authenticates seller users by verifying their email and password against the stored hashed password in the shopping_mall_sellerusers table.

Security best practices are applied including throttling, temporal locking on failed attempts, and hash comparison to prevent timing attacks.

Successful authentication issues JWT tokens with encoded claims for seller user identification allowing subsequent authorized requests.

This operation is related to registration and refresh token endpoints that manage the full authentication lifecycle.
operations.summary: Authenticate seller user credentials and issue JWT tokens, linked to shopping_mall_sellerusers table.

requestBody.description: Seller user login request body following IShoppingMallSellerUser.ILogin structure with email and password.

responseBody.description: Authentication authorized response containing JWT tokens and seller user profile data.

operations.name: login

operations.specification: Token refresh operation for seller users, validating a refresh token and issuing new access and refresh tokens. This endpoint operates on the shopping_mall_sellerusers role allowing continued authenticated sessions without re-login. It ensures refresh token validity, expiration management, and reissuance of JWT tokens reflecting updated claims. The endpoint requires authorizationType 'refresh' and runs with authenticated seller user context.
operations.description:
This API endpoint enables seller users to renew their JWT access tokens by providing a valid refresh token.

It validates the token against issued records and expiration constraints in the system tied to the shopping_mall_sellerusers role.

Upon validation, new access and refresh tokens are generated and returned within the IShoppingMallSellerUser.IAuthorized response format.

This complements the join and login operations, forming a complete token lifecycle management for seller users.
operations.summary: Refresh JWT tokens for seller users with valid refresh token, linked to shopping_mall_sellerusers table.

requestBody.description: Request containing valid refresh token for seller user, following IShoppingMallSellerUser.IRefresh structure.

responseBody.description: Authentication authorized response with new JWT tokens and seller user profile data.

operations.name: refresh

operations.specification: Allows seller users to request a password reset, initiating password recovery workflow. The operation accepts the email address of the seller user and validates existence in the shopping_mall_sellerusers table. If found, triggers an email or token based password reset procedure. This enhances security and self-service capabilities for seller users.
operations.description:
This API operation initiates a password reset process for seller users who have forgotten their password.

It accepts the user's registered email and triggers a verification and recovery email containing a secure token or link.

This process adheres to security best practices ensuring that no sensitive information is disclosed.

The operation relates to password change and password reset confirmation APIs forming a secure password recovery workflow.
operations.summary: Initiate password reset request for seller user accounts.

requestBody.description: Seller user password reset request, including registered email address, following IShoppingMallSellerUser.IResetPasswordRequest structure.

operations.name: requestPasswordReset

operations.specification: Allows seller users to confirm and complete password reset after receiving password reset token. The operation accepts the token, new password and validates the token's authenticity, expiry and linkage to the user in the shopping_mall_sellerusers table. On success, updates the password hash and invalidates the token. This secures the password reset completion step.
operations.description:
This API operation confirms the password reset request by verifying the reset token and setting the new password for the seller user.

It validates token authenticity, expiration, and associated user, then updates the password securely.

This operation finalizes the password recovery workflow complementing the reset request initiation.

Secure handling of token and password hashing is mandatory.
operations.summary: Confirm and apply new password for seller user password reset.

requestBody.description: Seller user password reset confirmation including reset token and new password, following IShoppingMallSellerUser.IResetPasswordConfirm structure.

operations.name: confirmPasswordReset

operations.specification: Allows authenticated seller users to change their password, requiring old password verification and new password setting. This protects account security by ensuring only the legitimate user can change credentials in the shopping_mall_sellerusers table. Operation mandates current authentication and verifies the old password hash before updating.
operations.description:
This API operation allows logged-in seller users to change their password by verifying the old password.

It ensures the requester is authenticated and validates the old password hash before securely updating to the new password.

The operation is part of overall account security features for seller users.

Additional logging and auditing may be applied for password changes.
operations.summary: Authenticated seller user password change operation with old password verification.

requestBody.description: Request body containing old and new password details, following IShoppingMallSellerUser.IChangePassword structure.

operations.name: changePassword

operations.specification:
These API operations provide user authentication and authorization for the system administrator role 'adminUser'. The operations include user registration (join), login to authenticate credentials, and token refresh to renew expired access tokens.

Users of this role have full administrative privileges on the shopping mall backend, managing users, sellers, products, orders, payments, and configurations.

- Registration (Join) operation at POST /auth/adminUser/join allows creating new admin accounts with essential credentials, issuing JWT tokens upon success.
- Login operation at POST /auth/adminUser/login handles authentication, verifies credentials, and issues access/refresh JWT tokens.
- Refresh operation at POST /auth/adminUser/refresh lets clients refresh their expired access tokens using a valid refresh token.

All these operations are public endpoints but require precise input validation and produce properly scoped authorization tokens to secure backend functionality.

This approach fulfills the security model defined by the 'admin' role kind ensuring robust authentication flows for system administrators.
operations.description:
The join operation creates new system administrator user accounts. It accepts registration info including email, password, nickname, and full name.

This process securely hashes passwords, validates unique email identities, and assigns admin privileges. Upon successful registration, the system issues JWT tokens allowing immediate authenticated access.

This operation is public and designed with security best practices to prevent unauthorized account creation and ensure admin user authenticity.

Clients should provide accurate and valid inputs conforming to schema constraints.

This operation complements login and refresh endpoints to provide full admin authentication lifecycle management.
operations.summary: Create new admin user accounts and issue JWT tokens for authorization.

requestBody.description: Information required to register a new admin user account.

responseBody.description: Authorization data including access and refresh JWT tokens.

operations.name: join

operations.specification:
This login operation enables system administrators to authenticate with their credentials and receive secure access tokens.

The operation accepts login credentials, validates the email and password, and issues JWT access and refresh tokens upon successful authentication.

It references the shopping_mall_adminusers table which stores admin user credentials, status, and profile information.

Security considerations include rate limiting, account lockout on multiple failed attempts, and usage of secure hashing for password verification.

This public endpoint is crucial for administrators to gain access to protected backend services.
operations.description:
Authenticate system administrator users and issue JWT tokens.

The operation validates administrator credentials against stored records in shopping_mall_adminusers.

On success, it issues JWT tokens that grant access to admin resources and operations.

Security mechanisms prevent brute force attacks and credential leaks.

This operation pairs with join and refresh endpoints to maintain admin authentication lifecycles.
operations.summary: Authenticate admin users and issue JWT access and refresh tokens.

requestBody.description: Login credentials for admin users.

responseBody.description: Authorization data including access and refresh JWT tokens.

operations.name: login

operations.specification:
This token refresh operation allows authenticated admins to renew their JWT access tokens without re-authenticating.

It accepts a valid refresh token, verifies its integrity and expiry, then issues new access and refresh tokens to maintain session continuity.

The refresh workflow prevents unauthorized token reuse and supports secure session management.

It references the admin user table shopping_mall_adminusers for token claims and validation.

This endpoint is essential for maintaining secure long-lived sessions while minimizing login frequency.
operations.description:
Refresh JWT access tokens for authenticated admin users.

The operation requires a valid refresh token and issues new authorization tokens upon verification.

It supports session continuity and secure token handling policies.

Only accessible for authenticated admins with valid refresh tokens.

Works alongside join and login endpoints to secure admin sessions.
operations.summary: Refresh JWT access tokens for admin users using a valid refresh token.

requestBody.description: Refresh token request body containing the current refresh token.

responseBody.description: New authorization data with fresh access and refresh tokens.

operations.name: refresh

operations.specification: This operation provides a filtered and paginated list of all shopping mall sales channels, allowing administrators to retrieve channels based on status or creation dates. It operates on the shopping_mall_channels table, supporting pagination and advanced filtering through request parameters defined in IShoppingMallChannel.IRequest. This enables authorized users to search and filter channels effectively.
operations.summary: Retrieve a list of shopping mall sales channels with filtering and pagination
operations.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of shopping mall sales channels.

This operation supports filtering by various criteria such as status, name, and creation date, allowing administrators to efficiently browse large numbers of channels. The response provides concise channel summaries with essential attributes.

Only users with adminUser role are authorized to access this data.

Validation ensures correct pagination and filter criteria format to prevent abuse or errors.

requestBody.description: Request parameters for filtering, sorting, and pagination of channels

responseBody.description: Paginated list of channel summary information

operations.name: index

operations.specification: This operation retrieves detailed information of a single shopping mall sales channel by its unique ID. It accesses all channel attributes stored in the shopping_mall_channels table, including code, name, description, status, and timestamps, providing a comprehensive view suitable for administrative review, editing, or auditing.
operations.summary: Retrieve detailed information of a sales channel by ID
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed information for a specific sales channel by its unique ID (UUID).

Access to this operation is restricted to adminUser.

It fetches all fields from the shopping_mall_channels entity and returns them in full detail.

Request validation includes ensuring the ID is in proper UUID format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target shopping mall sales channel

responseBody.description: Detailed shopping mall sales channel information

operations.name: at

operations.specification: This operation creates a new shopping mall sales channel. It accepts all necessary fields to define the channel, including code, name, description, and status, in a request body conforming to IShoppingMallChannel.ICreate. The operation validates uniqueness of the code and required properties, and returns the created channel on success.
operations.summary: Create a new shopping mall sales channel
operations.description:
Create a new sales channel in the shopping mall backend.

Required data includes unique code, name, optional description, and current status.

Only adminUser may perform this operation.

Validation ensures all required fields are present and code uniqueness is enforced.

Successfully created channel data is returned.

requestBody.description: New channel data to be created

operations.name: create

operations.specification: This operation updates an existing shopping mall sales channel identified by its unique ID. The request body conforms to IShoppingMallChannel.IUpdate schema, allowing modification of properties like code, name, description, and status. The operation validates uniqueness of code and proper formatting.
operations.summary: Update an existing shopping mall sales channel
operations.description:
Update details of an existing sales channel using its UUID.

adminUser are authorized to perform this operation.

Validation ensures the channel exists, the code remains unique, and updated status values are valid.

Returns the updated channel information on success.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the sales channel to update

requestBody.description: Updated data for the sales channel

responseBody.description: Updated shopping mall sales channel information

operations.name: update

operations.specification: This operation deletes a shopping mall sales channel by its unique ID. It performs a soft delete by setting the deleted_at timestamp as per the Prisma schema. The operation validates the channel ID and requires adminUser authorization due to the impact on multi-channel management.
operations.summary: Delete a shopping mall sales channel by ID (soft delete)
operations.description:
Delete a sales channel from the shopping mall platform identified by its UUID.

This operation marks the channel as deleted by setting the deleted_at timestamp (soft delete).

Only adminUser are authorized to execute this operation.

Validation checks ensure the provided ID is a valid UUID and the channel exists.

No response content is returned upon successful deletion.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the sales channel to delete

operations.name: erase

operations.specification: This operation lists shopping mall sections with support for complex filtering and pagination. The underlying shopping_mall_sections table supports soft deletion, status filtering, and searchable fields such as code and name. The IRequest request DTO enables specifying filtering criteria and pagination instructions.
operations.summary: Retrieve a paginated list of shopping mall spatial sections
operations.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of shopping mall spatial sections.

The operation supports filters on status, section name or code, with pagination and sorting capabilities.

Access is restricted to adminUser.

Errors returned on invalid parameters or authorization failures.

Response includes section summaries optimized for list display.

requestBody.description: Request parameters to filter, search, and paginate sections

responseBody.description: Paginated list of shopping mall section summaries

operations.name: index

operations.specification: This operation retrieves detailed information for a specific shopping mall section by its UUID. It includes all stored fields such as code, name, description, status, timestamps, and logical deletion flag. Access is controlled to adminUser only.
operations.summary: Retrieve a shopping mall section by ID
operations.description:
Get detailed information of a specific shopping mall section by its ID.

Only adminUser can perform this operation.

Validation ensures ID is a valid UUID and the section exists.

Returns full section details.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target shopping mall section

responseBody.description: Full details of the shopping mall section

operations.name: at

operations.specification: This operation creates a new spatial section within the shopping mall platform. The request body must conform to IShoppingMallSection.ICreate, providing code, name, optional description, and status. The operation validates input, ensures code uniqueness, and returns the newly created section record.
operations.summary: Create a new shopping mall spatial section
operations.description:
Create a new spatial section in the shopping mall system.

The section groups products and orders spatially and supports administrative configuration.

Validation enforces unique codes and valid input data.

Operation is restricted to adminUser.

Returns the created section data.

requestBody.description: Data required to create a new shopping mall section

responseBody.description: Newly created shopping mall section details

operations.name: create

operations.specification: This operation updates an existing section entity in the shopping mall system, which represents spatial groupings of products known as sections or store corners. It allows modification of the section's name, description, status, and code as defined in the shopping_mall_sections table from the Prisma schema. This update enforces validation of the section identifier (UUID) and aligns with system business rules about section lifecycle and status management. It requires user authorization for role-based access to perform updates safely.
operations.description:
This API endpoint allows authorized users to update detailed information of a section, which is used to spatially organize products within the shopping mall's multi-channel sales environment. The operation modifies section properties such as the unique code, display name, optional description, and current operational status.

Section updates are subject to validation against the Prisma schema shopping_mall_sections, ensuring data consistency and integrity. The endpoint accepts the section identifier as a path parameter and the updated content in the request body.

Security controls enforce role-based permissions restricting this operation to appropriate system users such as administrators or channel managers. Errors in updating due to invalid identifiers or data violations are handled with detailed responses.

This operation supports maintenance of the product classification structure and helps keep the mall's sections synchronized with business needs.
operations.summary: Update a specific product section by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target section

requestBody.description: Update data for the section entity

operations.name: updateSection

operations.specification: This operation permanently removes a section entity from the shopping mall database, identified by a UUID. The section entity is a spatial grouping of products and is represented by the shopping_mall_sections table in Prisma schema. The deletion is a hard delete since no soft delete columns are defined for this entity in the schema. Only authorized users with administrative roles may perform this irreversible removal.
operations.description:
Deletes a product section identified by its unique ID. Sections organize products spatially within channels in the shopping mall system.

This operation removes the section record entirely from the database and cannot be undone. It requires administrative authorization to ensure proper controls.

Upon successful deletion, no content is returned to confirm removal.

Errors such as nonexistent IDs or database constraints violations are reported in standard error responses.
operations.summary: Remove a product section permanently by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target section

operations.name: eraseSection

operations.specification: This operation retrieves a paginated list of shopping mall channel-category mappings. Each mapping associates a sales channel with a product category, allowing channel-specific category configurations as defined in the shopping_mall_channel_categories Prisma table. The operation accepts search/filter criteria, sorting options, and pagination controls.
operations.description:
Retrieves a list of shopping mall channel-category mappings with support for filtering, sorting, and pagination. Channel categories enable configuration of hierarchical product classifications per channel.

The operation processes search criteria to narrow down results and returns a paginated view of the matched mappings.

Security and role-based filtering restrict access to authorized administrators to manage channel category assignments and system configurations.
operations.summary: Search and retrieve channel category mappings

requestBody.description: Search and filter parameters for channel-category mappings

responseBody.description: Paginated list of channel-category summary objects

operations.name: indexChannelCategory

operations.specification: This operation retrieves detailed information of a single shopping mall channel-category mapping by its unique identifier. The channel-category mapping associates a sales channel with a product category to allow channel-specific product categorization, as described in the Prisma schema's shopping_mall_channel_categories table.
operations.description:
Retrieves detailed information of a channel-category mapping specified by its unique ID.

This mapping represents the link between a sales channel and a product category within the shopping mall system, enabling tailored product classification structures per channel.

Access is restricted to authorized administrative users to maintain system integrity and configuration consistency.

Potential errors include invalid IDs or unauthorized access handling.
operations.summary: Retrieve a specific channel category mapping by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target channel category mapping

operations.name: atChannelCategory

operations.specification: This operation creates a new shopping mall channel-category mapping, linking a sales channel with a product category to allow customized product categorization per channel. It operates on the shopping_mall_channel_categories table in the Prisma schema, supporting validation of inputs and uniqueness constraints on channel-category pairs.
operations.description:
Creates a new channel-category association in the shopping mall system.

This mapping defines which product categories belong to which sales channels to support multi-channel category configurations.

The API expects validated request data and enforces uniqueness of channel-category pairs.

Access control restricts creation to administrative roles with appropriate permissions.

On success, the newly created mapping's details are returned.
operations.summary: Create a new channel category mapping

requestBody.description: Creation data for new channel-category mapping

operations.name: createChannelCategory

operations.specification: This operation updates an existing channel-category mapping identified by a UUID. Channel-category mappings link sales channels with product categories, enabling channel-specific product classification. It follows business rules defined in the shopping_mall_channel_categories Prisma schema table to ensure data integrity and uniqueness.
operations.description:
Updates channel-category mapping details identified by its unique ID.

This allows modification of which product category is linked to which sales channel.

Access is restricted to authorized administrative roles.

The operation requires validation of the input data and enforces uniqueness constraints.

Errors due to invalid identifiers or data conflicts are properly managed.
operations.summary: Update a specific channel category mapping by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target channel category

requestBody.description: Update data for the channel-category mapping

operations.name: updateChannelCategory

operations.specification: This operation removes a channel-category mapping by its UUID. It deletes the association between a sales channel and a product category within the shopping mall. The removal is a permanent hard delete as the Prisma schema for channel-categories lacks soft delete column. Only authorized admins may perform this action.
operations.description:
Deletes a specific channel-category mapping identified by ID.

This removes the product category association from the specified sales channel.

Authorization is limited to administrators. The deletion is irreversible.

No response body is returned on success.

Errors for invalid IDs or permission issues are handled accordingly.
operations.summary: Remove a channel category mapping permanently by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target channel category

operations.name: eraseChannelCategory

operations.specification: Retrieves a paginated list of file attachments stored in the system for product, post, and resource media management. Supports filtering, sorting, and pagination to manage large datasets of attachment metadata. The endpoint corresponds to shopping_mall_attachments table operations.
operations.description:
Provides advanced search capabilities for managing attachment files uploaded to the shopping mall backend. This includes filtering by media type, created date, and other relevant metadata.

The attachments are browsable in pagination format for efficient data retrieval.

Access control restricts the endpoint to administrative users who manage CDN-resident files and metadata.

Errors include invalid filters or access denial.

Returned data includes file URLs, types, sizes, and timestamps.
operations.summary: Search and retrieve shopping mall attachment files

requestBody.description: Search parameters and pagination options for attachments

operations.name: indexAttachment

operations.specification: This operation retrieves attachment file metadata by its unique identifier from the "shopping_mall_attachments" table. It provides details like file_name, file_url (typically a CDN path), media_type, file_size, upload IP if any, and creation/update timestamps. This GET method requires no request body, has a path parameter 'id' expected to be a UUID, and returns a detailed single attachment record. The endpoint is publicly accessible or subject to internal authorization.
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed metadata of an attachment file specified by its UUID. This includes file name, URL pointing to storage/CDN, media type (e.g., image/png), file size in bytes, optional upload IP address, and created/updated timestamps.

This is a safe, read-only operation used to fetch attachment details for presentation or management.

If the specified ID does not exist, a 404 error response will be returned.

Authorization roles are not required or handled externally.

The 'id' parameter must be a valid UUID in string format.
operations.summary: Retrieve an attachment's metadata by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: UUID of the attachment to retrieve

operations.name: at

operations.specification:
This operation creates a new attachment metadata record representing an uploaded file. The attachment includes file name, unique file URL, MIME media type, file size in bytes, optional upload IP address, and timestamps. It writes to the "shopping_mall_attachments" table.

Requires user role to create attachments. Request body must confirm to IShoppingMallAttachments.ICreate interface with required fields.

Returns the created attachment entity with assigned UUID and audit timestamps.
operations.description:
Create a new attachment record storing metadata for uploaded files such as images and documents.

User must be authenticated as a member to perform this operation.

operations.specification: This operation permanently removes a shopping mall sale product by its unique ID. It interacts with the shopping_mall_sales table in the Prisma schema, representing products for sale. Deletion here is a hard delete of the record from the database. The operation directly removes the sale entry from the shopping_mall_sales table. Cascade deletion ensures that associated sale snapshots, sale units, and inventory items are removed to prevent orphaned records.

Only users with 'sellerUser' or 'adminUser' roles have the authority to perform this deletion due to the irreversible nature of the operation and its impact on product catalogs and order consistency. Attempts by unauthorized roles will be rejected.

Upon successful deletion, no response body is returned, but appropriate HTTP status codes communicate the result. Error handling covers cases such as non-existent saleId or insufficient permissions. This operation removes product data permanently and is not reversible through application logic.

Used to place new orders during checkout. Roles allowed are guestUser, memberUser, sellerUser, and adminUser, supporting secure order placement and initiation of fulfillment and payment workflows.
operations.description:
Creates a new order application record in the system using the provided data in the request body.

The operation requires appropriate authorization among guestUser, memberUser, sellerUser, or adminUser.

On success, the created order information is returned for confirmation and subsequent processing.

Validation errors are returned in case of missing or incorrect data.

This endpoint drives the crucial step of order placement and initiates downstream operations like payment processing.

operations.specification: This operation retrieves detailed information about a specific order item associated with a particular order. It operates on the shopping_mall_order_items entity within the Orders namespace of the Prisma schema. It allows authorized users with roles guestUser, memberUser, sellerUser or adminUser to obtain data about the ordered product snapshot linked to the order item, including quantity and price at order placement. Path parameters 'orderId' and 'orderItemId' identify the exact order and order item, ensuring secure and precise data retrieval.
operations.summary: Retrieve a specific order item information by orderId and orderItemId
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed information of a specific order item within an order. This operation allows authorized users (guestUser, memberUser, sellerUser, adminUser) to fetch data regarding a particular item ordered by the customer, referencing the product snapshot at the time of order placement to ensure consistency. The order item includes details such as quantity ordered and unit price.

Security: Only authorized roles can access order items.

The operation relates to the shopping_mall_order_items database table, which holds individual order line items referencing the shopping_mall_orders (via orderId) and shopping_mall_sale_snapshots (product snapshot).

Validation: Both 'orderId' and 'orderItemId' must be valid UUID strings identifying existing records. If the item or order does not exist, a suitable error response should be returned.

Expected behavior: Returns a single shopping mall order item entity matching the specified identifiers with full detail.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target order

parameters.name: orderItemId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target order item

responseBody.description: Detailed information of the specified order item

operations.name: at

operations.specification:
This operation creates a new order item under a specified order. It maps to the shopping_mall_order_items entity in the Orders namespace. Authorized users can add products to an existing order by providing a shopping mall order item creation payload. This payload includes the referenced product snapshot, quantity, and price information.

The order and order item relationship is validated through the path parameter 'orderId'.

This operation allows dynamic modification of order contents before finalization, enabling flexible order management workflows.
operations.summary: Add a new order item to a specific order
operations.description:
Create a new order item within a specified order. Authorized users (guestUser, memberUser, sellerUser, adminUser) can add products associated with specific snapshots to existing orders.

Security considerations require user authentication and permission validation to prevent unauthorized order modifications.

This operation relates to the shopping_mall_order_items table, requiring valid references to existing orders and product snapshots.

Validation includes ensuring quantity and price are positive numbers and the product snapshot exists.

On success, returns the full detailed order item record.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the target order

requestBody.description: Details of the order item to create

responseBody.description: Information of the created order item

This operation requires authorized user roles and permission checks for secure order item management.

The operation returns the updated order item entity upon successful modification.

The shopping_mall_order_items table is the source of truth, with updates validated against existing order and product snapshot references.

Validation includes ensuring no negative values for quantities and valid statuses.

Returns the updated order item information.

This operation deletes a specific order item from an order permanently. It operates on the shopping_mall_order_items table within the Orders namespace. The path parameters 'orderId' and 'orderItemId' provide the unique identifiers of the order and the order item to be removed.

This is a hard delete operation as the underlying schema does not indicate soft deletion fields for this entity. Deleted order items cannot be recovered.

Only authorized users with correct permissions can execute this operation.

The operation does not require a request body and returns no content upon success.
operations.summary: Erase a specific order item from an order
operations.description:
Delete a specific order item permanently from an order. This operation removes the record completely from the database.

Only authorized roles (guestUser, memberUser, sellerUser, adminUser) can perform this action.

The deletion affects the shopping_mall_order_items table as identified by the parameters.

No request body is required. On successful deletion, no response body is returned.

No request body is required. On successful deletion, no response body is returned.

operations.name: searchMileages

operations.specification: Operation for managing mileage points for customers (member users) in the shopping mall system. This includes fetching a specific mileage record, creating new mileage records, updating existing mileage records, and deleting mileage records. The operations interact with the 'shopping_mall_mileages' table in the Prisma schema which holds data about mileage balances, income/outcome, expired mileage, and references the associated guest or member users. Validations ensure that mileage data corresponds to actual users and changes comply with business rules for reward point management.
operations.description:
This set of API operations manages customer mileage records in the shopping mall backend system. The GET operation retrieves detailed mileage information for a specific mileage record identified by 'mileageId', including balances and accrued points. The POST operation allows creation of a new mileage record for a user with initial values and timestamps. The PUT operation updates an existing mileage record's balances and income/outcome history, ensuring the record remains consistent with business rules. The DELETE operation permanently removes a mileage record from the database, ensuring no residual data remains.

Security Considerations:
These operations require authenticated access typically by administrative roles, ensuring only authorized users can create, update or delete mileage records. Data privacy and integrity are enforced by restricting mutation operations.

Database Relationships:
Each mileage record is linked optionally to a guest user or member user, and changes reflect in the corresponding user's mileage accounts.

Validation Rules:
- Mileage IDs and user IDs must be valid UUIDs.
- Decimal fields (balances and income/outcome) must be non-negative where appropriate.
- Deleted records cannot be accessed or modified.

Error Handling:
Errors will be returned if invalid IDs are provided or if updates violate business constraints. Attempts to delete non-existent records will result in appropriate error responses.
operations.summary: Manage customer mileage records with full CRUD operations

parameters.name: mileageId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the mileage record

It requires providing user associations (member or guest), initial mileage balances, income and outcome values, expirations, and audit timestamps. The creation follows validations for non-negative balances, valid UUIDs for user references, and timestamp formats consistent with ISO 8601.

Security is restricted to admin roles to prevent unauthorized mileage manipulation.

The mileage record includes current balance, cumulative income and outcome points, expired points, and references to the user for future reward calculations.

Potential errors include duplicate records for the same user, invalid UUIDs, and out-of-range values for mileage points.

No request or response body is included as the operation solely deletes the specified record.
operations.description:
Permanently delete a specific dynamic pricing record by its unique identifier. This operation irreversibly removes the entry from the database.

Security is enforced by admin role restriction to prevent unauthorized deletion.

All related references must be managed prior to executing this deletion to preserve data integrity.

Deleting dynamic pricing records disables dynamic pricing adjustments for associated products.
operations.summary: Delete a specific dynamic pricing record from the shopping mall system

parameters.name: dynamicPricingId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the dynamic pricing record to delete

operations.name: erase

operations.specification:
Search and retrieve a filtered, paginated list of sentiment analysis records performed by AI on product and user-generated content. The operation supports extensive filtering criteria to analyze customer sentiment over time.

The underlying table is shopping_mall_sentiment_analysis that stores sentiment scores, categories, source texts, and analysis metadata per product and user.

Role-based access control restricts data retrieval to authorized users, such as adminUsers.

The response provides paginated sentiment summaries for dashboard or analytic consumption.
operations.description:
Retrieve a paginated and filtered list of customer sentiment analyses generated by AI models. This API supports querying records based on sentiment categories, score ranges, product IDs, dates, and user filters.

Security rules limit access to users with appropriate roles.

The shopping_mall_sentiment_analysis table contains AI-derived sentiment data linked to product and customer. This supports decision making in marketing and product management.

Typical use case includes analytics dashboards or reports extracting sentiment trends and distributions.

Errors may occur if filters are invalid or unauthorized access is detected.
operations.summary: Retrieve a paginated, filtered list of shopping mall customer sentiment analyses

requestBody.description: Filter and pagination parameters for customer sentiment queries

responseBody.description: Paginated sentiment analysis summaries matching filter criteria

operations.name: index

operations.specification:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific customer sentiment analysis record generated by AI in the shopping mall system. This data is stored in the shopping_mall_sentiment_analysis table.

Role-based access restricts this operation to authorized users.

The operation returns comprehensive sentiment details including score, category, source text, analysis date, and related user and product references.

Errors such as not found or unauthorized access may occur.
operations.description:
Get detailed information for a single customer sentiment analysis record by its unique identifier.

View includes sentiment score, category, original text analyzed, and contextual metadata.

Operation is restricted to authorized roles ensuring data confidentiality.

This supports detailed analytics and troubleshooting of AI sentiment model outputs.

Errors handled include invalid ID format, missing records, or access violations.
operations.summary: Retrieve a specific customer sentiment analysis record by ID

parameters.name: sentimentAnalysisId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the sentiment analysis record to retrieve

operations.name: at

operations.specification:
Create a new customer sentiment analysis record from AI model output. Stores data in the shopping_mall_sentiment_analysis table including user, product, sentiment score, category, source text, and metadata.

This operation enables ingesting new AI sentiment data for ongoing analytics.

Access is restricted to authorized users to ensure data integrity.

Validation includes score range, required fields, and correct foreign keys.

Typical usage is integration of AI service outputs.

Response returns created record with IDs and timestamps.
operations.description:
Create a new sentiment analysis record storing AI-generated customer sentiment data. This API accepts detailed sentiment scoring and text input linked to users and products.

Access control requires administrative privileges. Validation enforces data completeness and consistency.

Use this operation to add fresh AI analysis results for business insights and machine learning feedback.

Errors include invalid data, missing foreign keys, or unauthorized access.
operations.summary: Create a new customer sentiment analysis record

requestBody.description: Information needed to create a sentiment analysis record

operations.name: create

operations.specification:
Update an existing customer sentiment analysis record with new AI-derived data and metadata. The record is stored in the shopping_mall_sentiment_analysis table.

Access requires adminUser role authorization.

Validation checks ensure data integrity and prevent invalid updates.

The updated record is returned with all current fields and timestamps.

Errors include invalid IDs, unauthorized access, or data conflicts.
operations.description:
Update a sentiment analysis record identified by its unique ID. Modify fields such as sentiment score, sentiment category, source text, and analysis date.

Restricted to adminUser users for security.

Supports correction or enhancement of previously stored sentiment results.

Errors handled include invalid parameters, permissions, or record absence.
operations.summary: Update an existing sentiment analysis record

parameters.name: sentimentAnalysisId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the sentiment analysis record to update

requestBody.description: Updated data for sentiment analysis record

operations.name: update

operations.specification:
Delete a sentiment analysis record from the shopping mall system based on the unique ID. This performs a permanent removal as there is no soft-delete column defined.

adminUser role authorization is required to ensure secure data management.

Deleting sentiment analysis records affects AI feedback and analytic completeness.

No request or response body is needed for this operation.
operations.description:
Permanently delete a specific sentiment analysis record identified by ID from the shopping mall system.

This is a hard delete action removing the record completely.

Authorized only for adminUser roles to prevent data loss.

Ensure this operation is used cautiously when cleaning up obsolete or incorrect data.
operations.summary: Delete a specific sentiment analysis record from the shopping mall system

parameters.name: sentimentAnalysisId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the sentiment analysis record to delete

operations.name: erase

operations.specification:
List and filter analytic dashboards for the shopping mall system providing real-time analytic views. Supports paging, filtering, and sorting to manage dashboard configurations and execution logs.

Operates on the shopping_mall_analytics_dashboards table storing dashboard configurations and statuses.

Access is limited to users with adminUser roles.

The response returns paginated dashboard summaries for management or display.

Errors may include filter validation or authorization failures.
operations.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of analytics dashboards. Supports filters on dashboard type, status, and last execution time.

Access control is enforced for administrative roles.

The shopping_mall_analytics_dashboards table manages metadata for dashboards such as configurations and status.

Typical use cases include system monitoring, analytic display management, or operational oversight.

Errors returned when filters are invalid or user is unauthorized.
operations.summary: Retrieve a paginated list of analytic dashboards

requestBody.description: Filtering and pagination parameters for analytic dashboard listing

operations.name: index

operations.specification:
This operation retrieves the details of a specific shopping mall analytics dashboard identified by its unique ID from the shopping_mall_analytics_dashboards table. The analytics dashboard stores configuration and status information for various reporting and monitoring dashboards used in the shopping mall system.

Security mandates that this endpoint is accessible only to authorized admin users due to the sensitivity of analytics configurations.

The returned object includes dashboard type, stored JSON configuration, last execution timestamp, current status, creation and update timestamps, and logical deletion timestamp if set.

Errors will occur if the provided analyticsDashboardId is not a valid UUID or does not correspond to any existing dashboard.

This operation is read-only and provides detailed analytics dashboard data for administrative viewing and management purposes.
operations.summary: Get a specific analytics dashboard by ID

parameters.name: analyticsDashboardId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the analytics dashboard

operations.name: at
operations.description:
Retrieve detailed information of a specified analytics dashboard by its ID. This operation allows admin users to access the dashboard configuration JSON, status, and audit timestamps.

Only authenticated administrators are authorized to perform this action.

No side-effects occur in this operation; it is a safe, idempotent read operation suitable for display and auditing.

If the specified dashboard ID does not exist, a 404 error is returned.

This API complements create, update, and delete operations on analytics dashboards.

operations.specification:
Create a new analytics dashboard configuration record in shopping_mall_analytics_dashboards table. The client must provide the dashboard_type, configuration JSON string, last run datetime, and status string as per the IShoppingMallAnalyticsDashboard.ICreate schema.

Dashboard_type must be a unique identifier of the dashboard category.

Only users with adminUser role are authorized to create new dashboards.

The response returns the fully created dashboard including assigned ID and audit timestamps.

Errors include conflict on uniqueness of dashboard_type and validation errors on JSON payload.

This operation supports administrative dashboard lifecycle management.
operations.summary: Create a new analytics dashboard

requestBody.description: Analytics dashboard creation information

operations.name: create
operations.description:
Create a new analytics dashboard with configuration and operational metadata.

Requires adminUser authorization.

Request must provide dashboard_type, JSON configuration, last_run_at timestamp, and status.

Response returns the created dashboard record including ID and timestamps.

Validation errors include uniqueness constraints on dashboard_type.

Supports admin workflows for analytics dashboard management.

operations.specification:
Update an existing analytics dashboard identified by analyticsDashboardId path parameter with new data based on IShoppingMallAnalyticsDashboard.IUpdate request body schema.

Only authorized adminUser role can update the dashboard.

The updated dashboard entity is returned including all metadata and timestamps.

Validation handles existence and uniqueness constraints.

Errors include 404 when the dashboard does not exist and conflict if updated dashboard_type conflicts with existing records.

Supports modification of dashboard configuration, status, and last run timestamps.

This API complements create, read, and delete endpoints for dashboard lifecycle management.
operations.summary: Update an analytics dashboard by ID

parameters.name: analyticsDashboardId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the analytics dashboard

requestBody.description: Analytics dashboard update information

operations.name: update
operations.description:
Update an existing analytics dashboard by its ID with new configuration and metadata.

Requires adminUser authorization.

Input should include dashboard_type, configuration JSON, last_run_at datetime, and status.

Returns the updated analytics dashboard record.

Errors include 404 if the dashboard ID is not found and conflict if dashboard_type uniqueness is violated.

Supports dashboard lifecycle management by admin users.

operations.specification:
Performs a soft deletion of an analytics dashboard by setting a deleted_at timestamp field in the shopping_mall_analytics_dashboards table, identified by analyticsDashboardId path parameter.

This operation requires adminUser authorization.

No request body or response body is needed.

The soft delete allows logical deletion for audit and compliance.

Errors include 404 if the dashboard to delete does not exist.

The operation complements retrieval, creation, and update APIs for analytics dashboards.
operations.summary: Soft delete an analytics dashboard by ID

parameters.name: analyticsDashboardId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the analytics dashboard

operations.name: erase
operations.description:
Soft delete an analytics dashboard by its ID. This marks the record as deleted by setting the deleted_at timestamp.

Authorized only for adminUser role.

No request or response body.

Returns 204 No Content on successful soft deletion.

Supports full lifecycle management of analytics dashboards.

authorization.name: guestUser
authorization.description: Unauthenticated or minimal access users who can browse the shopping mall and access public resources. They can register or login but have limited access to personalized features.

authorization.name: memberUser
authorization.description: Authenticated customers who can purchase products, manage their account, post inquiries and reviews, and use rewards systems. They have access to personal data and order management.

authorization.name: sellerUser
authorization.description: Members granted seller permissions enabling them to register, manage, and sell products. Sellers can track sales performance and manage product inventory.

authorization.name: adminUser
authorization.description: System administrators with full access to manage users, sellers, products, orders, payments, and system configurations. Administrators have audit and role-based access control.

limit.description: Limitation of records per a page.

pages.description:
Total pages.

Equal to {@link records} / {@link limit} with ceiling.

access.description:
JWT access token for authenticated requests.

This token should be included in the Authorization header for subsequent
authenticated API requests as `Bearer {token}`.

refresh.description:
Refresh token for obtaining new access tokens.

This token can be used to request new access tokens when the current access
token expires, extending the user's session.

expired_at.description:
Access token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating when the access token will expire and
can no longer be used for authentication.

refreshable_until.description:
Refresh token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating the latest time until which the
refresh token can be used to obtain new access tokens.

IAuthorizationToken.description:
Authorization token response structure.

This interface defines the structure of the authorization token response
returned after successful user authentication. It contains both access and
refresh tokens along with their expiration information.

This token structure is automatically included in API schemas when the system
detects authorization roles in the requirements analysis phase. It provides a
standard format for JWT-based authentication across the generated backend
applications.
